document_data.name: Gomwick
document_data.mainbody:
'''Gomwick''' was a messenger for the [[Sword Coast Couriers]] who lived in [[Baldur's Gate]] during the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{Quote|Be doubly careful on the way back to Baldur's Gate...I can't have my best messenger winding up face down in a ditch somewhere.|Postmaster General [[Danzo]].}}
document_data.Relationships: He had a loyal and devoted friend in his [[dog]] [[Scratch (dog)|Scratch]].
document_data.History:
Gomwick was killed in the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, when delivering a bag of letters to [[Baldur's Gate]]. He was slain by a pack of [[gnoll]]s associated with the [[Cult of the Absolute]] that attacked travelers along the [[Risen Road]], and his body remained in the nearby forest. Scratch remained by his side for some time, sure that his friend would wake up soon.

[[Danzo Arkwright]], Gomwick's employer, sent out a carrier [[pigeon]] with a warning letter to Gomwick, telling him to be careful as there had been attacks and murders on the roads outside of Baldur's Gate. The letter never reached the courier.
